revised_title: Microscopic Observations of Pumice-Stone, Coral, and Spunges
tldr: The author examines the structure and composition of pumice-stone, coral, and sponges through the use of a microscope. He observes the unique and intricate internal structures of these materials and discusses their formation and growth in marine environments. The author also investigates the presence of salt and other minerals in pumice-stone and the possibility of sponge growth on rocks composed of these materials.
